        MapSceneInterface setRowAndCol(utility.Tuple count,
                               utility.Tuple size,
                               double scale)
        save date in the correct variables.
        Parameters:
        count - - number of rows and columns in the grid.
        size - - width and height of each cell in grid.
        scale - - a double multiplier for width and height of each grid cell.
        Returns:
        current instance of this class.

      • setAnimator

        MapSceneInterface setAnimator(sidescroller.animator.AnimatorInterface newAnimator)
        if current animator instance is not null stop it first. then assign the newAnimator to animator.
        Parameters:
        newAnimator - - new animator to set.
        Returns:
        current instance of this class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if argument is null.

        java.util.List<sidescroller.entity.property.Entity> players()

        players list.

      • createScene

        MapSceneInterface createScene(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)

        this method creates the static entities in the game.
        use MapBuilder#createBuilder() to get and instance of MapBuilder called mb.
        on mb call methods MapBuilder.setCanvas(Canvas), MapBuilder.setGrid(Tuple, Tuple), and MapBuilder.setGridScale(double).
        call all or any combination of build methods in MapBuilder to create custom map, does not have to be complex. one landmass and a tree is good enough.
        call MapBuilder.getBackground() and MapBuilder.getEntities(List) to retrieve the built entities.

        Parameters:
        canvas -
        Returns:

      • inMap

        boolean inMap(sidescroller.entity.property.HitBox hitbox)
        Parameters:
        hitbox - - hitbox of an entity to check if is it still in background bounds.
        Returns:
        true of hitbox of background containsBouns of argument.
